sentence1: The sorcerers and witches who dwelt there said: "Every year the river-god looks for a bride, who must be selected from among the people.
sentence2: If she be not found then wind and rain will not come at the proper seasons.

sentence1: If she be not found then wind and rain will not come at the proper seasons.
sentence2: And then, when a girl came of age in some wealthy family, the sorcerers would say that she should be selected.

sentence1: And then, when a girl came of age in some wealthy family, the sorcerers would say that she should be selected.
sentence2: Whereupon her parents, who wished to protect their daughter, would bribe them with large sums of money to look for some one else, till the sorcerers would give in.

sentence1: Whereupon her parents, who wished to protect their daughter, would bribe them with large sums of money to look for some one else, till the sorcerers would give in.
sentence2: They would order the rich folk to share the expense of buying some poor girl to be cast into the river.

sentence1: They would order the rich folk to share the expense of buying some poor girl to be cast into the river.
sentence2: But whoever would not pay, their daughter was chosen to be the bride of the river-god.

sentence1: But whoever would not pay, their daughter was chosen to be the bride of the river-god.
sentence2: She was forced to accept the wedding gifts which the sorcerers brought her.

sentence1: She was forced to accept the wedding gifts which the sorcerers brought her.
sentence2: The people of the district chafed grievously under this custom.

sentence1: The people of the district chafed grievously under this custom.
sentence2: Now when Si-Men entered into office, he heard of this evil custom.

sentence1: Now when Si-Men entered into office, he heard of this evil custom.
sentence2: He had the sorcerers come before him.

sentence1: He had the sorcerers come before him.
sentence2: He said: "See to it that you let me know when the day of the river-god's wedding comes.

sentence1: He said: "See to it that you let me know when the day of the river-god's wedding comes.
sentence2: I wish to be present to honor the god!

sentence1: I wish to be present to honor the god!
sentence2: This will please him.

sentence1: This will please him.
sentence2: In return he will shower blessings on my people."

sentence1: In return he will shower blessings on my people."
sentence2: With that he dismissed them.

sentence1: With that he dismissed them.
sentence2: So when the day arrived they gave him notice.

sentence1: So when the day arrived they gave him notice.
sentence2: Si-Men dressed himself in his robes of ceremony.

sentence1: Si-Men dressed himself in his robes of ceremony.
sentence2: He entered his chariot and drove to the river in festival procession.

sentence1: He entered his chariot and drove to the river in festival procession.
sentence2: And from far and near men, women and children had flocked together in order to see the show.

sentence1: And from far and near men, women and children had flocked together in order to see the show.
sentence2: The sorcerers placed the river-bride on a couch.

sentence1: The sorcerers placed the river-bride on a couch.
sentence2: They adorned her with her bridal jewels, and kettledrums, snaredrums and merry airs vied with each other in joyful sound.

sentence1: They adorned her with her bridal jewels, and kettledrums, snaredrums and merry airs vied with each other in joyful sound.
sentence2: They were about to thrust the couch into the stream.

sentence1: They were about to thrust the couch into the stream.
sentence2: The girl's parents said farewell to her amid tears.

sentence1: The girl's parents said farewell to her amid tears.
sentence2: But Si-Men bade them wait.

sentence1: But Si-Men bade them wait.
sentence2: He said: "Do not be in such a hurry!

sentence1: He said: "Do not be in such a hurry!
sentence2: I have appeared in person to escort the bride, hence everything must be done solemnly and in order.

sentence1: I have appeared in person to escort the bride, hence everything must be done solemnly and in order.
sentence2: Let him know that he may come himself and fetch his bride."

sentence1: Let him know that he may come himself and fetch his bride."
sentence2: And with these words he looked at a witch.

sentence1: And with these words he looked at a witch.
sentence2: He said: "You may go!"

sentence1: He said: "You may go!"
sentence2: The witch hesitated, but he ordered his servants to seize her and thrust her into the stream.

sentence1: The witch hesitated, but he ordered his servants to seize her and thrust her into the stream.
sentence2: "That woman did not understand her business," continued Si-Men, "or else she would have been back long ago!"

sentence1: "That woman did not understand her business," continued Si-Men, "or else she would have been back long ago!"
sentence2: And with that he looked at one of the sorcerers.

sentence1: And with that he looked at one of the sorcerers.
sentence2: He added: "Do you go and do better!"

sentence1: He added: "Do you go and do better!"
sentence2: The sorcerer paled with fear, but Si-Men had him seized and cast into the river.

sentence1: The sorcerer paled with fear, but Si-Men had him seized and cast into the river.
sentence2: Then Si-Men pretended to be uneasy.

sentence1: Then Si-Men pretended to be uneasy.
sentence2: "Both of them have made a botch of their errand," said he, "and are causing the bride to wait in vain!"

sentence1: "Both of them have made a botch of their errand," said he, "and are causing the bride to wait in vain!"
sentence2: Once more he looked at a sorcerer.

sentence1: Once more he looked at a sorcerer.
sentence2: He said: "Do you go and hunt them up!"

sentence1: He said: "Do you go and hunt them up!"
sentence2: But the sorcerer flung himself on the ground and begged for mercy.

sentence1: But the sorcerer flung himself on the ground and begged for mercy.
sentence2: And all the rest of the sorcerers and witches knelt to him in a row, and pleaded for grace.

sentence1: And all the rest of the sorcerers and witches knelt to him in a row, and pleaded for grace.
sentence2: And they took an oath that they would never again seek a bride for the river-god.

sentence1: And they took an oath that they would never again seek a bride for the river-god.
sentence2: Then Si-Men held his hand.
